negotiator.logging

Class CsvLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.logging.CsvLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class CsvLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Logger interface that writes the log to a comma separated value file (.csv file) File is created upon logger interface creation and logger class should be released (i.e. log.close() to release internal file handle when done with logger). *
    Author:
    David Festen

    • Constructor Detail

      • CsvLogger

        public CsvLogger(java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes a new instance of the CsvLogger class. Initializing this class opens a print stream, the user of the instance should take care to close (i.e. logger.close()) this instance when done.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to log to (including the .csv extension)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown by the PrintStream if the location is not writable.
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • join

        public static java.lang.String join(java.util.Collection<?> s,
                    java.lang.String delimiter)
        Helper method. Joins all the elements in the collection using the given delimiter. For each element the to string function is used to generate the string.
        Parameters:
        s - Collection of objects to create string of
        delimiter - The delimiter used between object
        Returns:
        The string delimited with the given delimiter

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.Object value)
        Log a given object. This actually just adds it to the buffer, to print to file, call logLine() afterwards.
        Parameters:
        value - The object to log

      • logLine

        public void logLine(java.lang.Object... values)
        Logs a complete line to the file.
        Parameters:
        values - zero or more objects to log, using ; delimiter

        Parameters:

      • getUtils

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getUtils(java.util.List<NegotiationPartyInternal> parties,
                                        Bid agreement,
                                        boolean discount)
        Parameters:
        parties - the parties in the nego
        agreement - the reached agreement, or null if there was no agreement.
        discount - true iff you want the discounted utilities.
        Returns:
        list with (possibly discounted) utilities/res value of each of the parties. Res value is only used if agreement=null.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this stream and releases any system resources associated with it. If the stream is already closed then invoking this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
